title: Why is Spear of Shojin still in ARAM?
body:
It's not like the champions who abused it in summoners rift are not abusing it in aram, and it's not magically a decent item on every other champ in aram either. You got rid of it for a reason, so why only in SR? 

Any rioters care to explain?

replies.body: Aram will be the new TT, riot will completely ignore it
Pretty much. you have all the nerfed champions that feel shitty, senna pretty much is an auto win if the game goes onto long, and poke champs are still a problem
Likely because the abusers that can use it in aram are generally some of the weakest champions in all of aram, given few melee non tanks are even decent.

In low MMR aram sure. In high MMR matches SoS abusers are actually really strong. Jax, Rene for example are amazing SoS users in aram in the hands of people that know how to anicancel and combo with them.
Riven on the other hand is not in such a good place

Except they all pretty handily get wrecked by poke, as long as the rng gives you some kind of frontline.

Poke is overrated. Once you reach a reasonably mid-high aram MMR(top 20% or higher) and people know to dodge and play to their strenghts (only go for all ins not short trades etc) poke is not that good at all.
Also, snowball is really good on these champs. And guardian's horn is a cheap AF answer to poke.

And they still lose to poke. Snowball isnt that great if you have a frontline doing their job compared to the damage poke can put out, especially if one of the pokes is an adc like ashe who can take towers before renekton gets the 3+ items to be relevant.

Not to mention shojin makes them irrelevant for longer, as its not defensive enough to deal with the constant abuse youre forced to take. Doesnt matter how well you can dodge skillshots when the law of large numbers comes to play, and you add in 3+ sources of things to dodge at all times.

Step 1, get better MMR in aram.

Step 2, come tell me if poke is still relevant. 


I am telling you, all in comps win vs poke most times. Poke has been heavily nerfed both because of the range penalty and the individual champ nerfs and buffs. 

LB for example has something like 20% extra damage, while poke champs have almost all of them +incoming damage. This means you oneshot them without hitting half your kit. 
Riot decided to buff/nerfed based on low MMR ARAM and that has completely changed the higher MMR matches because people there already knew how to play those "bad aram" champs and now they are even stronger. I checked your aram history, I don't expect you to understand.

Have a great day
